## Euclid × SPT-3G MoU Project

Cross-correlation analysis between SPT-3G CMB lensing and Euclid DR1 galaxy density and shear, targeting the CMB lensing block of the 6×2pt data vector $\delta_{\rm g} \kappa_{\rm CMB}, \gamma \kappa_{\rm CMB}, \kappa_{\rm CMB} \kappa_{\rm CMB}$.

**Expected Impact**:

- $\gamma \kappa_{\rm CMB}$: ~14% improvement in $\Omega_m, \sigma_8$ figure of merit for SPT-3G × DR1 South
- $\delta_{\rm g} \kappa_{\rm CMB}$: Combined SNR ~60 across Main and Summer fields

![Credit: Margherita Lembo](images/euclid_cmbx_rr2dr1_footprints.png){width=90%}

## Analysis Ingredients:

- Euclid data: shear & position catalogs, mass maps, $n(z)$s
- SPT data: ACT, SPT, Planck covergence maps & masks 
- Correlated simulations:
  - for covariance: something simple & cheap
  - for bias characterization: something realistic & expensive
    - Euclid side: FS2 | CMB side: [Agora (Omori 2024)](https://arxiv.org/abs/2212.07420) | how to combine TBD...
  
- Harmonic space analysis
  - `namaster`, `polspice`, `heracles`
  - pixel- and catalog-based

## Systematics: Survey Property Map Cross-Correlations

- Following DES × SPT methodology: quantify potential systematic contamination
- If a contaminant affects both CMB lensing and galaxy fields, it produces spurious cross-correlation signal

**Cross-correlation score**:
$$X^{f}_{\mathcal{S}}(\theta) = \frac{\langle \kappa_{\rm CMB} \mathcal{S}(\theta)\rangle \, \langle f \mathcal{S}(\theta)\rangle}{\langle \mathcal{S} \mathcal{S}(\theta)\rangle}$$

where $\mathcal{S}$ is a survey property map and $f$ is either $\delta_g$ (galaxy density) or $\gamma_t$ (tangential shear)

- $X^{f}_{\mathcal{S}} \approx 0$ unless systematic correlates with **both** fields
- Compare magnitude to statistical uncertainty of cross-correlation

## Systematics Templates for DR1

**For galaxy-CMB lensing ($\delta_g \times \kappa_{\rm CMB}$)**:

- Stellar density (from Gaia)
- Galactic extinction

**For shear-CMB lensing ($\gamma_t \times \kappa_{\rm CMB}$)**:

- Stellar density and extinction
- PSF model errors: $q = e_* - e_{\rm model}$ (ellipticity residuals)
- PSF model errors: $w = e_*(T_* - T_{\rm model})/T_*$ (size-dependent)

**Connection to DR1 WL validation**: Euclid DR1 validation tests include similar systematic map cross-correlations—natural integration point for CMBX analysis pipeline
